treatment.description: Irregular, angular cocci occurring individually or occasionally in clumps or tetras. Gram-negative. Cell wall is an S-layer. Slowly motile by one or two flagella. Stictly anaerobic. Grows most rapidly at 35-45˚C (growth range, 20-50˚C), 0.4-0.7 M Na+ (growth range 0.2-2.1 M Na+) and pH 8.7-9.5 (growth range pH 8-10). Bicarbonate is required. Energy metabolism is by the formation of methane from methylamines, emthanol, or dimethylsulfide. Acetate, formate, H2/CO2, tetramethylammonium, pyruvate, and alcohols other than methanol are not used. The mol% G+C is 40.1 (Tm). Isoalted from sediments of a lake in the Lake Magadi.
